trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment ISE
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment ISE

trans-unit.source: powershell,cmdlet
trans-unit.target: powershell,cmdlet

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE)
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE)

trans-unit.source: The Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE) is one of two hosts for the Windows PowerShell engine and language.
trans-unit.target: The Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE) is one of two hosts for the Windows PowerShell engine and language.

trans-unit.source: With it you can write, run, and test scripts in ways that are not available in the Windows PowerShell Console.
trans-unit.target: With it you can write, run, and test scripts in ways that are not available in the Windows PowerShell Console.

trans-unit.source: The ISE adds syntax-coloring, tab completion, IntelliSense, visual debugging, and context sensitive Help.
trans-unit.target: The ISE adds syntax-coloring, tab completion, IntelliSense, visual debugging, and context sensitive Help.

trans-unit.source: The ISE lets you run commands in a console pane, but it also supports panes that you can use to simultaneously view the source code of your script and other tools that can plug into the ISE.
trans-unit.target: The ISE lets you run commands in a console pane, but it also supports panes that you can use to simultaneously view the source code of your script and other tools that can plug into the ISE.

trans-unit.source: You can even open up multiple script windows at the same time, which is especially helpful when you are debugging a script that uses functions defined in other scripts or modules.
trans-unit.target: You can even open up multiple script windows at the same time, which is especially helpful when you are debugging a script that uses functions defined in other scripts or modules.

trans-unit.source: What’s New
trans-unit.target: What’s New

trans-unit.source: Here are some of the features that have been added to the ISE in the most recent releases of PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Here are some of the features that have been added to the ISE in the most recent releases of PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Added in PowerShell 3.0 (Windows Server 2012, Windows 8)
trans-unit.target: Added in PowerShell 3.0 (Windows Server 2012, Windows 8)

trans-unit.source: **IntelliSense** automatically completes your commands by displaying menus of matching cmdlets, parameters, parameter values, files, or folders as you type.
trans-unit.target: **IntelliSense** automatically completes your commands by displaying menus of matching cmdlets, parameters, parameter values, files, or folders as you type.

trans-unit.source: **Snippets** are short sections of code that you can easily insert into the scripts your write.
trans-unit.target: **Snippets** are short sections of code that you can easily insert into the scripts your write.

trans-unit.source: A collection of useful snippets is included in the box and you can more by using the **New-Snippet** cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: A collection of useful snippets is included in the box and you can more by using the **New-Snippet** cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: **Add-on tools** that add features to the ISE can be created by writing code that interacts with the [The Windows PowerShell ISE Scripting Object Model](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd819478.aspx).
trans-unit.target: **Add-on tools** that add features to the ISE can be created by writing code that interacts with the [The Windows PowerShell ISE Scripting Object Model](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd819478.aspx).

trans-unit.source: These tools can display controls in a tabbed pane or work invisibly in the background.
trans-unit.target: These tools can display controls in a tabbed pane or work invisibly in the background.

trans-unit.source: The **Commands** add-on is a good example and is included with version 3.0 and later that displays a list of the available commands and their Help.
trans-unit.target: The **Commands** add-on is a good example and is included with version 3.0 and later that displays a list of the available commands and their Help.

trans-unit.source: **Restart Manager and Auto-save** automatically save your scripts every two minutes to help you avoid the loss of your work in the event of a crash or unexpected restart.
trans-unit.target: **Restart Manager and Auto-save** automatically save your scripts every two minutes to help you avoid the loss of your work in the event of a crash or unexpected restart.

trans-unit.source: **Most Recently Used list** is now part of the File Open menu to make it easier to get to the files you use most often.
trans-unit.target: **Most Recently Used list** is now part of the File Open menu to make it easier to get to the files you use most often.

trans-unit.source: **Merged Console pane**.
trans-unit.target: **Merged Console pane**.

trans-unit.source: In previous versions of the ISE there were separate Command and Output panes.
trans-unit.target: In previous versions of the ISE there were separate Command and Output panes.

trans-unit.source: They are now combined into a single pane that more directly mimics what you see in the Windows Powershell Console.
trans-unit.target: They are now combined into a single pane that more directly mimics what you see in the Windows Powershell Console.

trans-unit.source: **Command-line switches**.
trans-unit.target: **Command-line switches**.

trans-unit.source: Several new command-line switches give you more control over the way the ISE works.
trans-unit.target: Several new command-line switches give you more control over the way the ISE works.

trans-unit.source: –NoProfile starts the ISE without running a profile script.
trans-unit.target: –NoProfile starts the ISE without running a profile script.

trans-unit.source: –Help opens up a help window with the ISE.
trans-unit.target: –Help opens up a help window with the ISE.

trans-unit.source: –mta starts the ISE in “multi-threaded apartment mode”.
trans-unit.target: –mta starts the ISE in “multi-threaded apartment mode”.

trans-unit.source: The default is single-threaded.
trans-unit.target: The default is single-threaded.

trans-unit.source: **New editor features** make it easier to create and read your code:
trans-unit.target: **New editor features** make it easier to create and read your code:

trans-unit.source: **XML syntax coloring**.
trans-unit.target: **XML syntax coloring**.

trans-unit.source: The ISE editor now colors XML syntax in the same way as it colors Windows PowerShell code syntax.
trans-unit.target: The ISE editor now colors XML syntax in the same way as it colors Windows PowerShell code syntax.

trans-unit.source: **Brace matching**.
trans-unit.target: **Brace matching**.

trans-unit.source: The ISEWindows PowerShell ISE highlights matching braces to help you ensure you have the right number of closing braces to match your opening ones.
trans-unit.target: The ISEWindows PowerShell ISE highlights matching braces to help you ensure you have the right number of closing braces to match your opening ones.

trans-unit.source: Use CTRL-\[ to locate the closing brace that matches the opening brace that the cursor is on.
trans-unit.target: Use CTRL-\[ to locate the closing brace that matches the opening brace that the cursor is on.

trans-unit.source: **Outline view**.
trans-unit.target: **Outline view**.

trans-unit.source: You can collapse or expand sections of your code by clicking the plus and minus signs in the left margin.
trans-unit.target: You can collapse or expand sections of your code by clicking the plus and minus signs in the left margin.

trans-unit.source: This makes it easier to find the code you’re looking for in a long script.
trans-unit.target: This makes it easier to find the code you’re looking for in a long script.

trans-unit.source: **Drag and drop text editing**.
trans-unit.target: **Drag and drop text editing**.

trans-unit.source: You can select a block of text and drag it to another location to move it.
trans-unit.target: You can select a block of text and drag it to another location to move it.

trans-unit.source: If you hold down the Ctrl key while you drag the selected text you copy instead of move.
trans-unit.target: If you hold down the Ctrl key while you drag the selected text you copy instead of move.

trans-unit.source: **Parse error display**.
trans-unit.target: **Parse error display**.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell examines your script as you type.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell examines your script as you type.

trans-unit.source: If it detects an error, it shows a red squiggle under the offending code.
trans-unit.target: If it detects an error, it shows a red squiggle under the offending code.

trans-unit.source: When you hover over the indicated error, a tooltip shows you the problem that was found.
trans-unit.target: When you hover over the indicated error, a tooltip shows you the problem that was found.

trans-unit.source: **Zoom**.
trans-unit.target: **Zoom**.

trans-unit.source: You can zoom in on your text to make it easier to read or zoom out to see the bigger picture by using the slider in the bottom-right corner of the ISE window.
trans-unit.target: You can zoom in on your text to make it easier to read or zoom out to see the bigger picture by using the slider in the bottom-right corner of the ISE window.

trans-unit.source: **Rich text copy and paste**.
trans-unit.target: **Rich text copy and paste**.

trans-unit.source: When you copy from the ISE to the clipboard, the font, size, and color information of the selected text is included.
trans-unit.target: When you copy from the ISE to the clipboard, the font, size, and color information of the selected text is included.

trans-unit.source: **Block selection**.
trans-unit.target: **Block selection**.

trans-unit.source: You can select a block-shaped chunk of text by holding down the ALT key while selecting text in the script pane with your mouse, or by pressing **Alt+Shift+Arrow**.
trans-unit.target: You can select a block-shaped chunk of text by holding down the ALT key while selecting text in the script pane with your mouse, or by pressing **Alt+Shift+Arrow**.

trans-unit.source: Added in PowerShell 2.0 (Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 7
trans-unit.target: Added in PowerShell 2.0 (Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 7

trans-unit.source: The ISE was introduced with PowerShell v2.0.
trans-unit.target: The ISE was introduced with PowerShell v2.0.

trans-unit.source: Requirements for running the Windows PowerShell ISE
trans-unit.target: Requirements for running the Windows PowerShell ISE

trans-unit.source: The ISE is available on any computer that can run Windows PowerShell v2.0 or later.
trans-unit.target: The ISE is available on any computer that can run Windows PowerShell v2.0 or later.

trans-unit.source: Each version of Windows and Windows Server includes a version of Windows PowerShell and the ISE, but you can upgrade to the latest available by installing the Windows Management Framework.
trans-unit.target: Each version of Windows and Windows Server includes a version of Windows PowerShell and the ISE, but you can upgrade to the latest available by installing the Windows Management Framework.

trans-unit.source: Run this search to find the latest version available: [Downloads](http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/search/DownloadResults.aspx?q=%22windows%20management%20framework%22%20PowerShell&sortby=Relevancy~Descending).
trans-unit.target: Run this search to find the latest version available: [Downloads](http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/search/DownloadResults.aspx?q=%22windows%20management%20framework%22%20PowerShell&sortby=Relevancy~Descending).

trans-unit.source: Note that any entries labelled "Preview" are pre-release code and are not feature complete.
trans-unit.target: Note that any entries labelled "Preview" are pre-release code and are not feature complete.

trans-unit.source: Because Windows PowerShell ISE requires a graphical user interface, you can’t run it on the Server Core option of Windows Server.
trans-unit.target: Because Windows PowerShell ISE requires a graphical user interface, you can’t run it on the Server Core option of Windows Server.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: [Using the Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/cc732148.aspx)
trans-unit.target: [Using the Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/cc732148.aspx)
